title: Lotus FM
text:
Lotus FM (formerly, Radio Lotus) is a South African national <a href="radio%20station">radio station</a> based in <a href="Durban">Durban</a>, loosely similar to the <a href="BBC%20Asian%20Network">BBC Asian Network</a> in the United Kingdom, that caters for the needs of the <a href="Indian%20South%20Africans">Indian South African</a> community. It combines a mix of <a href="Music%20of%20India">Indian music</a>, <a href="news">news</a>, <a href="current%20affairs%20%28news%20format%29">current affairs</a>, <a href="interview">interview</a>s and <a href="entertainment">entertainment</a>. Lotus FM targets South African Indians between the ages of 25-34 (core) and 35-49 (secondary) in the <a href="Standard%20of%20living">LSM</a> 7-10 segment.
Lotus FM has occasionally been the subject of complaints, with people of <a href="South%20India">South India</a>n descent claiming that the station's broadcasts favour <a href="Hindi%20language">Hindi</a> music over <a href="Tamil%20language">Tamil</a> music.
The Lotus FM studio complex is based at the <a href="SABC">SABC</a> in <a href="Durban">Durban</a>, next to the famous <a href="Kingsmead%20Cricket%20Ground">Kingsmead</a> Cricket stadium.
